headline.main: Smaller Spotlight for a Big-Time Correspondent

lead_paragraph: This is how Peter Arnett assesses his reputation right now: ''Damaged goods.'' Ten years ago, few television correspondents were better known than Mr. Arnett. For weeks during the Persian Gulf war, he was the only TV reporter in Baghdad. With exclusive video of the United States bombing campaign in Iraq, his dispatches for CNN became the envy of his broadcast news competitors and forged the network's reputation globally.
abstract: Television news organizations covering war in Afghanistan spurn services of Peter Arnett, veteran war correspondent whose career was sullied by involvement in discredited CNN report accusing US of using nerve gas against defectors in Laos during Vietnam War; he will cover Afghan war for BNN, independent video company, which plans to syndicate his reporting; photo (M)
